description: A 3-ft (or about 1 m) jumper cable, like you've seen many times before: it's a short multi-stranded copper cable with power leads on either end, whose main purpose is to share power between vehicles, but can also link other electrical systems.
A long 30-ft (or about 10 m) orange extension cord for connecting appliances.  Could be used on any appliance or other household electrical system.
An extra long 100-ft (or about 30 m) orange extension cord for connecting outdoor appliances.  Could be used on any appliance or other household electrical system.
An extremely heavy-duty 75-ft (or about 24 m) tow cable made from thick steel wire.  If attached to a vehicle, it could be used to pull another vehicle of any weight.

A long, thick, heavy-duty cable with power leads on either end.  It looks like you could use it to hook up two vehicles to each other, though you expect the power loss would be noticeable.  Can also link other electrical systems.
This is the cable of the gods: 50 meters long, no power loss, light as a feather and fits in a matchbook.  You're sure this wasn't supposed to exist, and the way it shimmers makes you uneasy.
